title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 01 September 2014 - XWiki
content:
<Denis> has quit

08:56 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:59 <mflorea> has quit  
09:14 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
09:20 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:22 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:22 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:23 <vmassol> good morning (sorry I didn't notice my adium didn't reconnect this morning, just noticing now...)  
09:24 <vmassol> ci is again in bad shape....  
09:24 <vmassol> today is supposed is to be the RC1 release  
09:24 <vmassol> but : 1) we have some blockers and 2) build is not passing  
09:28 <vmassol> we currently have 8 issues marked 6.2RC1: http://jira.xwiki.org/issues/?jql=fixVersion%20%3D%20%226.2-rc-1%22%20and%20resolution%3DUnresolved  
09:29 <vmassol> 6 now  
09:30 <Pbas> has joined #xwiki  
09:30 <vmassol> tmortagne: what do you want to do about http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-10632 ?  
09:32 <tmortagne> vmassol: will move it to 6.3 I guess  
09:32 <tmortagne> I don't think I will have time to finish that for 6.2  
09:33 <tmortagne> I have some ideas in my head but did not started coding much yet  
09:34 <vmassol> ok  
09:38 <vmassol> tmortagne: what about http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-10446 ?  
09:39 <tmortagne> vmassol: I don't have much more to say that what I already commented in the issue, it's the same thing with any page that require PR  
09:39 <tmortagne> it's not really new  
09:39 <vmassol> doesn't make it better!  
09:39 <vmassol> makes it even more urgent to fix  
09:40 <vmassol> what it means is that we cannot wait for this new signing fwk  
09:40 <vmassol> what we coud do  
09:41 <tmortagne> the issue is only for a wiki not created by an admin which is not the most common use case either  
09:41 <vmassol> is forbid the creation of a subwiki for normal users till this gets fixed  
09:41 <vmassol> actually it's not admin, it's user with PR right?  
09:41 <tmortagne> by default "normal" user does not have the right to create a wiki, the admin need to explicitely give allgroup the right to do it  
09:42 <tmortagne> sure but it's rare that main wiki admin don't have PR  
09:42 <vmassol> I know that's supposed to be a feature :)  
09:42 <vmassol> (the ability for non admins to create wikis)  
09:42 <tmortagne> a wiki created from a template should not have the issue  
09:43 <tmortagne> I don't think copy document change the author  
09:43 <vmassol> why couldn't we set a user with PR in the context during the provisioning and put back the normal user after?  
09:44 <tmortagne> it's not during the provisioning  
09:44 <tmortagne> the use case here is when an empty wiki is created and you install the UI with DW  
09:44 <tmortagne> where the DW is executed with a user that does not have PR  
09:45 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
09:46 <vmassol> is guillaumeD on holidays today?  
09:46 <vmassol> checking  
09:47 <vmassol> he shouldn't be  
09:47 <vmassol> must be sleeping :)  
10:02 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
10:12 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:15 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
10:17 <Sidali> has joined #xwiki  
10:23 <Sidali> is now known as <sdjebloun>  
10:37 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
10:54 <Lyes> has quit  
10:56 <vmassol> fixing CLIRR  
10:56 <vmassol> (just noticed it)  
10:56 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: I'm here  
10:56 <gdelhumeau> (I was reading the logs)  
10:57 <vmassol> hmm I broke a lot of APIs in ExportURLFactory...  
10:57 <vmassol> see http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/5999/console  
10:57 <vmassol> I refactored them into an ExportURLFactoryContext class  
10:57 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
10:58 <vmassol> I needed to pass that info to some EP I introduced to handle webjars urls  
10:58 <vmassol> I forgot api compat when doing so…  
10:58 <vmassol> now I wonder what I should do...  
11:00 <vmassol> tmortagne: any input on this?  
11:01 <vmassol> it's an old api so maybe it's a problem to break it?  
11:01 <tmortagne> vmassol: finishing with http://vps.semesterofcode.com (last one) and I'm all yours  
11:01 <vmassol> although ExportURLFactory is not that commonly used I believe  
11:01 <vmassol> ok  
11:06 <tmortagne> vmassol: ExportURLFactory is used for pdf and html export AFAIK but yes it's pretty internal if that's what you mean  
11:06 <tmortagne> checking the changes you made  
11:06 <vmassol> ok thanks  
11:09 <tmortagne> vmassol: the only breakage is that you removed getNeededSkins() and getExportedSkinFiles() ?  
11:10 <vmassol> more than that  
11:10 <vmassol> there are 4 api changes  
11:10 <vmassol> since some fields were protected too  
11:10 <vmassol> [ERROR] 6001: com.xpn.xwiki.web.ExportURLFactory: Removed field exportDir  
11:10 <vmassol> I moved all of these in a ExportURLFactoryContext class  
11:11 <tmortagne> the method are easy to deprecated since they just need to call the same methods in factoryContext from what I saw  
11:11 <vmassol> indeed  
11:11 <tmortagne> s/deprecated/deprecate/  
11:12 <vmassol> I could do that, would it be enough?  
11:12 <tmortagne> for the fields that's another story but it's not the same level, using that class is one thing, extending it is something  more advanced  
11:12 <tmortagne> deprecated those field is pretty much impossible  
11:12 <tmortagne> or then just keep them  
11:13 <tmortagne> just so that the code that would use then don't crash but they would not do anything  
11:13 <tmortagne> still better that nothing  
11:13 <vmassol> only issue is that if they're modified in the context it won't be reflected  
11:13 <tmortagne> sure  
11:13 <tmortagne> just mean they won't have any effect but it won't crash  
11:18 <cjd> 2014-09-01 05:17:22,413 [http://blk1:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/] ERROR faultDocumentTranslationBundle - Failed to get localization bundle  
11:18 <cjd> java.lang.NullPointerException: null  
11:18 <cjd> in milestone 2  
11:18 <cjd> known?  
11:21 <vmassol> cjd: yes known  
11:21 <vmassol> and fixed  
11:22 <vmassol> in RC1  
11:22 <vmassol> thanks  
11:22 <cjd> thank you  
11:22 <tmortagne> one was fixed at least  
11:22 <tmortagne> cjd: was at startup ?  
11:22 <cjd> yes  
11:23 <cjd> I grabbed m2 from xwiki.org  
11:23 <tmortagne> ok so that should be it, race condition between init screen and the actual init (that happen to initialize some wiki translations at the same time)  
11:23 <cjd> ok so I'll just use the snapshot then  
11:25 <tmortagne> cjd: accessig your wiki using /get/ action instead of /view/ (i.e. never execute init screen) might work as a workaround  
11:25 <cjd> I'm just looking for a very new "clean" wiki for developing against  
11:25 <cjd> setting up my environment again after holidays  
11:25 <tmortagne> ok, snapshot should be ok, RC1 is near anyway  
11:28 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
11:28 <vmassol> clirr issue fixed, sorry about that  
11:35 <Lyes> has quit  
11:36 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
11:46 <Lyes1> has joined #xwiki  
11:46 <Lyes> has quit  
11:53 <cjd> fyi same issue in   xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb-6.2-20140829.123421-167.zip  
11:54 <cjd> fixed over the weekend?  
11:55 <mflorea> has quit  
11:56 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
11:58 <gdelhumeau> I have still no more ideas on XWIKI-10661  
12:00 <cjd> crash?  
12:00 <cjd> Segmentation Fault?  
12:00 <gdelhumeau> looks like it  
12:00 <cjd> Illegal Operation and microsoft doesn't know what they're doing error?  
12:00 <cjd> lol  
12:01 <cjd> #SoExploitable  
12:01 <cjd> are you able to isolate exactly what causes the crash in a plain .html file w/ no xwiki?  
12:03 <gdelhumeau> no  
12:03 <cjd> That's where I'd start  
12:03 <cjd> get the most basic wiki page which triggers it and "save page" in chrome  
12:03 <cjd> then spin up a little static server to host the page and hit it with ie, see if you can kill it  
12:04 <cjd> then you have an html file and you just need to keep simplifying it until you have the one thing which causes the crash  
12:04 <gdelhumeau> cjd: http://jira.xwiki.org/secure/attachment/28583/crash.png  
12:05 <gdelhumeau> I actually know which CSS rule causes a problem  
12:06 <cjd> maybe  
12:06 <cjd> usually it's many rules which interact in a problematic way  
12:12 <gdelhumeau> but not why in this very specific situations  
12:13 <gdelhumeau> because the exact same rules does not make any  crash in view mode  
12:13 <gdelhumeau> and the problem is that these CSS rules are from bootstrap, that I try to keep unmodified  
12:13 <gdelhumeau> and, BTW, I have not tried to debug this one:  http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-10664 (fun too)  
12:13 <cjd> mmm well it must not \*always\* crash ie9 because otherwise half the web would crash it :)  
12:20 <cjd> ahh ok enterprise build is disabled  
12:21 <tmortagne> cjd: checking, the fix was friday  
12:22 <tmortagne> but given that platform failed to build often it's possible the latest XE build is not very up to date  
12:22 <cjd> /nod  
12:42 <Lyes1> has quit  
12:43 <gdelhumeau> has quit

13:00 <Denis> has quit  
13:07 <gdelhumeau> where $xwikiCfgDefaultSkin is setted?  
13:07 <gdelhumeau> in PackageMojo?  
13:11 <vmassol>                   <xwikiCfgDefaultSkin>${xwiki.cfg.defaultskin}</xwikiCfgDefaultSkin>  
13:11 <vmassol> ?  
13:11 <vmassol> (just done a search in IDEA)  
13:11 <vmassol> set in the pom of enterprise  
13:11 <gdelhumeau> indeed sorry  
13:11 <gdelhumeau> so I need to find {xwiki.cfg.defaultskin  
13:11 <vmassol> but  
13:11 <vmassol> it seems you're overwriting it in PackageMojo  
13:11 <vmassol> props.setProperty("xwikiCfgDefaultSkin", "flamingo");  
13:12 <vmassol> ah no  
13:12 <vmassol> that's default  
13:12 <vmassol> if not set  
13:12 <gdelhumeau> I got it  
13:12 <gdelhumeau> sorry for the noise  
13:12 <vmassol> ok  
13:23 <Lyes1> has joined #xwiki  
13:23 <Lyes> has quit  
13:26 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
13:49 <cjd> tmortagne: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/RTWYSIWYG-10 does this make any sense to you?  I've confirmed that the .class file is indeed in the websocket extension jar.  
13:51 <tmortagne> cjd: I don't know Atmosphere enough to tell you why you get a nullpointer in it  
13:51 <sdjebloun\_> has joined #xwiki  
13:51 <tmortagne> do you have a bit more debug information than what's on the issue ?  
13:52 <cjd> err null pointer?  
13:52 <tmortagne> Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException: null         at org.atmosphere.cpr.AtmosphereFramework.info(AtmosphereFramework.java:707) ~[na:na]         at org.atmosphere.cpr.AtmosphereFramework.init(AtmosphereFramework.java:680) ~[na:na]         ... 74 common frames omitted  
13:52 <tmortagne> last one seems to be http://pastebin.com/RM1VLh7T  
13:53 <sdjebloun> has quit  
13:53 <cjd> java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.atmosphere.cpr.DefaultBroadcaster <-- this one caught my attention  
13:53 <cjd> it's a distinct log line  
13:53 <tmortagne> if you talk about java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.atmosphere.cpr.DefaultBroadcaster it's probably that you look at the wrong classloader some way  
13:53 <tmortagne> from where is this class loader exactly ?  
13:53 <tmortagne> and where is it installed exatly ?  
13:53 <tmortagne> in a wiki or at farm level ?  
13:54 <tmortagne> s/loader/loaded/  
13:54 <cjd> right, I'll ask the person who reported it, that's a good thought  
13:55 <tmortagne> without much information I would say this class is in a package installed at some wiki level and is loaded from another wiki or in some background thread that don't have the right thread context classloader  
13:55 <cjd> mmm  
13:55 <cjd> that sounds right  
13:56 <sdjebloun\_> has quit  
13:59 <sdjebloun> has joined #xwiki  
14:33 <tmortagne> vmassol: is it me of the spam (new page kid of spam) increased a bit on xwiki.org ?  
14:33 <tmortagne> s/kid/kind/  
14:33 <vmassol> not sure  
14:33 <vmassol> it's still light  
14:33 <vmassol> but yes maybe a slightly up  
14:33 <tmortagne> sure it's still easy to manage  
14:34 <vmassol> it's a good sign i guess  
14:34 <tmortagne> :)  
14:36 <vmassol> tmortagne: did you see that the guy who added the migraine spam also tweeted about it  
14:37 <cjd> could make people identify w/ email before letting them spam  
14:37 <vmassol> I'm hesitating to report as spam since there's xwiki in the tweet's content....  
14:37 <vmassol> :)  
14:37 <tmortagne> vmassol: nop did not seen it  
14:37 <vmassol> I don't want to paste the url here to not do more advertising for that spam....  
14:41 <cjd> I wonder if being seen in a spam tweet hurts your gscore  
14:46 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> has joined #xwiki  
14:47 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> Hello, Anyone knows what is the expected date for the 6.2 release?  
14:48 <tmortagne> xwikiorg\_guest\_2: the planned date is 15 sep  
14:49 <tmortagne> see http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Roadmaps/WebHome  
14:49 <tmortagne> we are a bit late for the RC1 that was supposed to be today so it's possible we will be a bit late on final I guess but not much more than a few days we hope  
14:50 <vmassol> cjd: ping  
14:50 <octo\_> is now known as <octo>  
14:52 <vmassol> cjd: in https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/87479eb you added baseUrl : '/'. could you explain why it's needed? It's causing trouble when exporting in HTML  
14:54 <vmassol> AFAICS it's not required since our APIs: getSkinFile(), webajrs.url(), etc always return a path relatvie to the root  
14:55 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> Ok, thanks for the information  
14:55 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> !  
14:58 <cjd> vmassol: hmm I thought that would have been there since the very beginning  
14:59 <cjd> without it the path is appended to the page name which is basically never what you want (if I recall correctly)  
14:59 <msmeria> has quit  
15:00 <vmassol> it works fine without it from what I tested  
15:00 <cjd> XWIKI-9354  
15:01 <cjd> make sure you require more than just jquery since that package is kind of "special"  
15:02 <cjd> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/006968b921  
15:02 <cjd> so in the beginning it was there, mflorea removed it and I re-added it  
15:02 <vmassol> my question is about baseUrl, not the rest  
15:02 <cjd> yes  
15:02 <vmassol> I'm not touching the rest  
15:03 <cjd> I don't think it will work correctly but you can test by doing like   require('/fake.nonexistant.js', function () { })  
15:03 <cjd> then check what it requests  
15:03 <cjd> if it requests  bin/view/Main/TestPage/fake.nonexistant.js then there will be problems  
15:04 <vmassol> but jquery and bootstrap loads fine already  
15:04 <vmassol> http://localhost:8080/xwiki/resources/js/amd/jquery.js  
15:04 <vmassol> and http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/webjars/resources/path?value=bootstrap/3.2.0/js/bootstrap.js  
15:04 <cjd> 15:01 <@cjd> make sure you require more than just jquery since that package is kind of "special"  
15:04 <vmassol> this is from chrom dev tool network's tab  
15:05 <vmassol> bootstrap is not jquery AFAIK  
15:05 <cjd> :)  
15:06 <cjd> if it (fails to) load(s) a nonexistant .js file correctly then it's fine  
15:08 <vmassol> there's no http call to load fake.nonexistant.js  
15:09 <cjd> mmm  
15:09 <cjd> it probably happened but it was redirected to Main/WebHome so that's what showed up  
15:09 <cjd> "preserve log" might help  
15:11 <vmassol> not better  
15:11 <cjd> hm  
15:12 <cjd> it should be fine for 99% of everything  
15:12 <cjd> webviewers might be problematic if that changes, newer stuff will not because I'm now always pre-defining paths  
15:13 <cjd> this business of relative paths is a big selling point for require.js but it's also a big source of bugs so I avoid it now  
15:15 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
15:25 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> has quit  
15:31 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
15:32 <gdelhumeau> cjd: "save as" of firefox does not save the content of the iframe  
15:32 <cjd> oh, it only happens inside of an iframe?  
15:33 <cjd> ok I thought you had isolated it to something that could be reproduced w/o the wysiwyg  
15:33 <cjd> hmm  
15:34 <gdelhumeau> the wysiwyg editor uses an iframe  
15:34 <cjd> /nod  
15:34 <gdelhumeau> no I didn't  
15:34 <cjd> the wysiwyg introduced a lot of other variables...  
15:34 <gdelhumeau> the problem comes from \*somewhere\* in the wysiwyg  
15:34 <cjd> \*introduces  
15:36 <cjd> there must be a way to reconstruct a working wysiwyg outside of xwiki  
15:36 <cjd> then you can start removing things  
15:37 <cjd> snapshot the page as it is, then grab the content of the iframe into another html file  
15:37 <cjd> just find what the wysiwyg loads, load it manually and put it in another file  
15:37 <cjd> then try loading the result  
15:40 <cjd> https://gcc.gnu.org/wiki/A\_guide\_to\_testcase\_reduction <-- this is basically what you want to do  
15:40 <cjd> there are probably a half dozen variables which need to be in place in order to trigger the crash, knowing exactly what they are will allow you to find one which is harmless and change it  
16:52 <vmassol> how hackish is that? :)  
16:54 <cjd> would have been better to do it in js so as not to rely so heavily on the XWiki CPP :)  
16:54 <cjd> other than that, fine  
16:54 <tmortagne> "because" ?  
16:54 <tmortagne> "(Note that we cannot do this generically in the webjars module when exporting in HTML because" and it stops there)  
16:54 <vmassol> ah indeed you want to know the end of the story… :)  
16:54 <vmassol> fixing  
16:57 <vmassol> Lyes1: I see you modified the forum app at https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/application-forum2/commit/e0f5f346a9197ffc81badcb7c05c9a2044639a99 for flamingo. Will it still work in colibri?  
16:58 <vmassol> I guess so but curious  
16:58 <vmassol> I guess some classes just won't have any effect in colibri right?  
16:58 <vmassol> for ex :class="document-info col-xs-12 col-md-7">  
16:59 <vmassol> Lyes1: this code "<span class="glyphicon glyphicon-plus"" means the forum app will require XWiki 6.2 right?  
17:00 <Lyes1> Yes it still work in colibri  
17:01 <Lyes1> in colibri we have a link for "Add forum" instead of the bootstrap button  
17:02 <vmassol> what I mean is that we probably should be careful that apps continue to work in both skins for  a while  
17:02 <vmassol> we haven't really discussed this on the list  
17:02 <vmassol> but we should  
17:02 <vmassol> I think at least till the 6.x cycle is over  
17:02 <vmassol> ie till there's a super stable 6.x version  
17:03 <vmassol> 6.4.x  
17:05 <Lyes1> this is what I'm trying to do, i test in both skins  
17:07 <vmassol> ok  
17:07 <vmassol> cool  
17:07 <vmassol> :)  
17:07 <vmassol> only 29 issues remaining to get an nice HTML export  
17:07 <vmassol> ....  
17:08 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
17:10 <vmassol> nice name....  
17:49 <cjd> Denis: I need SSL private keys for the websocket infra, specifically I need a java.security.KeyStore to create a javax.net.ssl.SSLContext, do you think anything you did is reusable for this?  
17:51 <Denis> cjd: it does not support KeyStore, but it can create assymetric keys and convert them to the javax PrivateKey and PublicKey types, so I would say partly  
17:52 <cjd> hmm.. I'll probably just access a keystore on the filesystem, esp. since admins are going to be especially nervous about ssl keys  
17:52 <Denis> do you need certificate as well ?  
17:53 <Denis> ok  
17:53 <cjd> yeah, I would need the cert  
17:54 <Denis> why do you need a keystore ?  
17:55 <cjd> Nettosphire requires an SSLContext and the SSLContext is initialized using an array of KeyManager  
17:56 <cjd> and KeyManagerFactory will create such a thing if it is brought the --broomstick of the wicked witch of the west--  err  KeyStore  
17:57 <mflorea> has quit  
17:58 <Denis> you could as well implement a X509KeyManager using my API  
17:59 <cjd> hmm  
17:59 <cjd> do you have means to store privkey/cert pairs?  
17:59 <cjd> or I should ask, how do you store these?  
17:59 <Denis> in either a XWiki Doc, a XWiki Space or a file on the fs in binary form, yes
